document_data.name: Uzbeg
document_data.caption: Uzbeg and the Lake of Mists.
document_data.mainbody: '''Uzbeg''' was a village near the [[Lake of Mists]] in the [[Hordelands]] between [[Kara-Tur]] and [[Faerûn]].
document_data.Geography: The village was located along the [[Golden Way]] which connected the continents of Kara-Tur and Faerûn. Uzbeg was the only residential in stop in the Hordelands.
document_data.Inhabitants: In [[1479 DR]], the population of Uzbeg was five hundred [[human]]s who made a living fishing in the Lake of Mists and trading goods.
document_data.History: During the [[Spellplague]], Uzbeg was settled by [[Raumviran]]s with aid from merchants from [[Thesk]] to be a trade route along the Golden Way.
document_data.Notable locations: Uzbeg had four [[caravanserai]]s, which were like inns but under the sway of eastern and migrant cultures. These caravanserais included stables, inns, shops, warehouses, and were like a small trade city.
